intro: Dactylorhiza × rizeana, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, violet or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine, though its primary ornamental value lies in its showy blooms. Dactylorhiza × rizeana is a popular choice for gardeners seeking a striking, easy-to-care-for orchid.
